alert.note: Alert for Collingsworth (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 04 at 3:52PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Collingsworth County through 430 PM CDT... At 352 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles southeast of Wellington, moving southwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wellington and Dodson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. These type of funnel clouds are harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
